content:
@Lloyd McKenzie we are taking 3 FHIR IGs to ballot:

  • https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/ (This IG has already been published)
  • https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-bfdr/
  • https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-vr-common-ig/ SPECIAL CASE - FMG wanted us to change the id and canonical from "ig" to "library", so it's a bit weird

@David deRoode is working on sorting out the Jira specification files for all three.

What should the specification/@url be for each of these?

I'm thinking:

  • http://hl7.org/fhir/us/ecr/ (because this is what it already is)
  • http://hl7.org/fhir/us/bfdr/
  • http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrcl (?????)

Is there some heuristic we should use to determine these or is this something that you guys do on your end?
it's agreed to by FMG when it approves the IG proposal

Ah ok.

So @David deRoode it's actually in the proposal:
The common ig is: us/fhir-vr-common-library and the other two are correct.
Thanks @Grahame Grieve - will try to remember for next time!
So what does the ballotUrl have on the end? "2021JAN"?
Don't worry about the ballotUrl if you don't want to - it's not currently used
